Juvo+ (Juvo Plus, Inc.) is a leading developer and marketer of consumer products across eighteen brands, working with the largest marketplaces and retailers in the world. We create products that transform houses to homes, that celebrate the big and little moments in life, and that make everyday things more manageable. We constantly apply Retail Science™, our in-house approach to leveraging data, applying machine learning tools, and next-gen processes to continually expand our catalog, delighting our customers and swiftly moving to meet our mission of having at least one of our products in every home.We’re committed to building upon our success through the selection and development of outstanding people, with the understanding that as we grow, you grow. From top to bottom, our team fosters a collaborative environment where we drive results, optimize our efforts, and achieve amazing things – while having a great time and celebrating our successes along the way!ABOUT THE POSITION:We are looking for an experienced Director of Data Engineering who has demonstrated success in building and deploying a modern scalable data platform that enables both power and end users to effectively answer business questions, test hypotheses, and leverage the visualization layer without needing to be a SQL or schema expert.In partnership with the cross-functional business owners, you will be responsible for owning data environments, integrating with new technologies, and overseeing the development of new processes that support teams across the global organization, to scale our capabilities in concert with the growth of the business and needs of our customers.RESPONSIBILITIES: Act as the Technical Product Owner and partner with Business Product Owners to define the technical strategy and solutions for our data and analytics products. Own and define roadmaps, drive end-to-end execution of related technology projects, and drive operational excellence initiatives.Responsible for enterprise-level center of excellence (CoE) best practices in standards, guidelines, principles & frameworks on data architecture, data engineering, and data analytics solutions for an ecommerce (I.e., supply chain, inventory, customer, marketing, and product) data planes.Design and implement full data solutions which cover migration, change management, day-to-day executionCreate conceptual data models for business process improvements & data architectureCollaborate and communicate effectively with Product, QA, Data and DevOps teams to release projects on time with high quality output.Grow, lead, and mentor a team of global engineers and guide team to transform business requirements into technical architectures/specifications.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline. Additional professional work experience can be substituted on a year for year basis in lieu of a bachelor's degree.8+ years of experience designing and building with the track record of building and delivering mission critical, production software systems.5+ years leading global data/engineering teams and providing executive business insights & roadmaps.A result-oriented data champion supporting strategic business initiatives, prioritizing key projects based on ROI, and promoting strong Data Governance.Demonstrated experience mentoring data teams nurturing organizational data management culture.Experience in ecommerce/retail environments with demonstrated understanding of key data elements, metrics, and requirements within the ecommerce/retail space (i.e., understands inventory, orders, segmentation, SEO/SEM, conversion).Experience simplifying both processes and technical implementations.Passionate about technology, sense of ownership with good team spirit under fast paced working environment.Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English), strong business acumen, and an innate drive to deliver results.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Linux Environments.REST Architecture, service-oriented architecture.SQL, multi dimension data modeling, and ETL technologiesAmazon Web Services. Lambda, S3, EC2 (or similar cloud) environments.Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language, Python is preferred. Practical experience with a range of ML technologies is a plus.NOTICE TO US APPLICANTS: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the environment and level of work being performed by this job. This job posting and the associated job description in no way states or implies that the duties and responsibilities listed herein are the only tasks to be performed by the incumbent employee in this job. Additionally, the benefits and perks outlined are provided at the sole discretion of Juvo Plus, Inc., and are subject to change with or without notice, unless otherwise provided or protected by law.NOTICE TO CA APPLICANTS:The compensation range for this position is USD $192,400.00 to $307,840 (PG16). However, our anticipated hiring range for this position is USD $192,400.00 to $250,120.00. Additionally, this role is eligible for incentive compensation above and beyond the range noted through participation in our Success Sharing Leadership Bonus Plan. Actual compensation will be based on a candidate’s experience, education, final employment location, and alignment with the defined expectations and qualifications for the position.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY & DIVERSITY AT JUVO+We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourages applicants from all walks of life to apply. Applicants requiring assistance or an accommodation in the hiring process due to a disability may contact the Juvo+ People & Culture Team at hr.us@juvoplus.com for assistance. Please note that we do not respond to or provide applicant status updates via this email address.Juvo Plus, Inc. participates in E-Verify. For more information on E-Verify, please click here . Additionally, we conduct pre-employment background checks, reference checks, and drug testing for applicable positions/candidates.Juvo Plus, Inc., actively complies with the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). For a copy of our Workforce Privacy Policy, please click here .
